export_format.description: Per-patient folders with timestamp naming. Each data class exported as a separate file named [DataClassName].[format] where format is csv, json, or xml (user-selectable). A Documents subfolder contains imported items, images, and related documents in their original format. Population exports create one folder per patient.

clinical.evidence: Clinical Notes (extensive: ChiefComplaint, HPI, ROS, PMH, PhysicalExam, Assessment, Plan, plus vitals, tobacco, pregnancy fields), Allergies and Intolerances, List Problem, Medications, Lab Tests (very detailed with results), Vital Signs, Immunizations, Injections, Functional Status, Smoking Statuses, Goals, Health Concerns, Assesments, Plan of Treatment, Risk Factors

secure_messages.evidence: Email data class with fields: PatientID, DateSent, SentFromFirstName, SentFromLastName, EmailFrom, SentToFirstName, SentToLastName, EmailTo, Subject, CarbonCopy, Body. This appears to be patient-provider email/messaging.

billing_financial.evidence: Billing History data class with extensive fields: PlaceOfService, Complexity, CPTCode, CPTdescription, Fee, Charge, CPTUnits, CPTPrice, NDCCode, NDCUnits, ICD1-ICD12, ModifierCode, PriorAuthorizationNumber, plus full facility and billing/referring provider details. Procedures data class also has CPTCode, Fee, Charge, Units, Price.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Health Insurance data class with fields: Description, PolicyNumber, GroupNumber, GroupName, CoPay, InsuranceStartDate, InsuranceEndDate, PayorName, PlanName, PlanCode, InsPhoneNumber, InsAddress, SubscriberRelation/name/address, GuarantorRelation/name/address.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Scheduling data class with fields: PatientID, AppointmentDate, VisitType, Comments, BookedByFirstName/LastName, DateBooked, ProviderFirstName/LastName, Duration, XLinkProviderID, VisitIdExternal, IsEditable, IsTelehealth.

documents_images.evidence: Imported Items data class (ImportedBy, DateOfItem, TypeOfItem, ItemSubject, ItemFrom, ItemCurrentPath, etc.) plus the Documents subfolder described in the intro which preserves 'original storage or import format' for imported items, images, and related documents. Clinical Notes also references Image1/Image2/Illustration locations.

audit_trails.evidence: No dedicated audit trail or access log data class. Some fields track who entered/edited records (e.g., AddedByFirstName, EditedByFirstName, DateAdded, DateEdited on Allergies; RecordedBy on Immunizations; SavedBy on Directives) but no system-level audit log of who viewed records.

issues: Documentation lists column names but not data types, constraints, or value set enumerations
No sample export files or test data provided
No schema definition (DDL, JSON Schema, XSD) — just column name listings in a PDF table
No audit trail/access log data class despite this being part of the Designated Record Set

Some apparent typos in the PDF: 'Assesments' (should be Assessments), 'ChiefCompliant' (should be ChiefComplaint), 'BillingProvideerState' (extra 'e'), 'Signetur' (should be Signature in Medications Pending)
summary: CareTracker's Amazing Charts provides a concise 8-page PDF documenting 44 data classes exported as CSV/JSON/XML files in per-patient folders. The documentation lists column headings for each data class but lacks data types, value sets, or schema definitions. Coverage is reasonably broad — clinical notes, billing with CPT/ICD codes and charges, insurance, scheduling, medications, labs, immunizations, documents/images, and email/messaging are all present. Notable gaps include no audit trail and no sample data.
